page.title: 12The River Dulas
page.content: The river starts at Moelfre Uchaf and flows into the sea at Llanddulas.Wildlife in the river includes trout,ducks,water rats and occasional salmon.The Community Council have introduced the ducks to make the river banks into a pleasant leisure spot.There are 6 bridges crossing the River Dulas in Llanddulas,including the railway bridge,delaying trains for 5 weeks to build a temporary bridge.Many people fish in the river for trout or salmon. On the right in the estuary,there is a large rock pile.Many people have hurt themselves on it,including Mark Hodge,who slipped off rocks into 10 feet of water.His dad,a non-swimmer,jumped in and dragged Mark out of the water,resuscitated him,and carried Mark home.
